Key Arguments: Government censorship is wrong and stifles necessary debate and sharing of knowledge.
The US example where a judge criticized the government for infringing on free speech is cited as a warning.
Free speech should not be monopolized by the government or any entity.
Past experiences with Covid-19 narratives show that what is labeled as misinformation can later be proven true.
Robust debate is essential to avoid policy errors.
Notable Quotes: This law effectively legitimises government censorship.
No government or its appointed agencies should impose its own brand of truth on the general public.
Catastrophic policy errors are best avoided by robust debate and NOT censorship of dissenting voices.
